summary: An email chain from October 2019 regarding the delivery of security camera equipment (PTZ Cameras) to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The correspondence confirms delivery dates in November 2018 and includes tracking numbers.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Program Manager for FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, who sent an email confirming delivery of equipment to MCC New York.

events.title: Delivery of Equipment to MCC New York
events.description: Multiple shipments of equipment (tracking numbers provided) were delivered to the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Additional Equipment Delivery
events.description: Another shipment of equipment was delivered to MCC New York.

events.title: Further Equipment Delivery
events.description: A shipment of equipment was delivered to MCC New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
Beltsville, MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions office)
keyFacts: This document is an email chain from October 2019 discussing the delivery of outside PTZ Cameras to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
Justin Houston, a Program Manager for FBOP Contracts, confirms that most equipment was delivered on November 23, 2018, with additional deliveries on November 26 and 29, 2018.
The document provides specific tracking numbers for the delivered equipment shipments.
The correspondence involves a Communication Technician from the US Department of Justice at MCC-New York, though their name is not provided in the visible text.
The document is routine logistical correspondence about security equipment delivery to the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
